image.altText: Nurse in home

props.synopsis: Union representatives say it took four nurses getting assaulted and a prohibition order before Canberra Health Services listened to their calls for safety. Now they say safety is worse than before.

title.children: Nurses assaulted, met with machetes: Union says safety more than box ticking

props.synopsis: The National Library is asking for contributions to its election ephemera collection which it's been building since federation, collecting posters of former Prime Minister John Howard, flyers for Kevin ’07 and even how to vote cards from the early 1900s.

title.children: Election pamphlets may be 'annoying' but they tell a story of Australia

image.altText: Dutton looks serious, part of the frame is filled by the backs of reporters

props.synopsis: ACT politicians Andrew Leigh and David Pocock slam Peter Dutton's commitment today to cut 41,000 Canberra-based public service jobs.

title.children: 'Mathematical innumeracy': Dutton's commitment to cut Canberra public service slammed

image.altText: A woman in glasses holds her baby who wears a grey wiggles jumpsuit.

props.synopsis: The mother-of-two is among a growing number of people seeking out food relief for the first time, which includes families and people with stable jobs and mortgages.

title.children: Skylee turned to free food pantries to feed her family and she's far from alone

image.altText: A middle-aged, fair-haired woman in a brightly-coloured blazer.

props.synopsis: Katy Gallagher says her seniority as finance minister helps her advocate for Canberra. She admits independent Senator David Pocock is popular, but says her party has more muscle.

title.children: Gallagher seeks fourth Senate win but concedes Pocock's popularity

image.altText: Senate House of Reps generic composite

props.synopsis: ACT residents will be voting for both their House of Representatives member and their two Senate representatives in the federal election on Saturday May 3.

title.children: Voting in the ACT this federal election? Here's what you should know

image.altText: A woman in a paint-splattered button down shirt looks upward while painting on a canvas.

props.synopsis: With a canvas strapped to her back atop her bike, artist Sophie Baker cuts an unusual figure in the Canberra bush — now artists like her are ditching the studio to embrace painting in the open air as part of a new festival.

title.children: 'Into the bush': Artists ditch the studio to embrace open air painting

image.altText: Two men shakes head in front of a podium

props.synopsis: The major party leaders went head to head on national security and the cost of living, in a fiery debate hosted by Seven.

title.children: Dutton and Albanese spar over Welcome to Country ceremonies in final debate

image.altText: A graphic of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton cut-outs

props.synopsis: Both leaders have stepped up the tempo of their campaigns, hoping to win over undecided voters with just five days to go until polling day. Follow live.

title.children: Election result is going to be 'very tight' this weekend says Jason Clare

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Election result is going to be 'very tight': Jason Clare
Albanese, Dutton kick off the morning in Sydney

image.altText: An Asian woman, a blonde woman, a man in security uniform, woman with a dog, a young blonde girl and a European woman.

props.synopsis: The families of the six victims of last year's Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing attack are bracing for the start of the coronial inquest, which gets underway this morning.

title.children: Victims, emergency response, health services under scrutiny at Bondi inquest

image.altText: Emergency service workers standing on the street at night.

props.synopsis: Vancouver Police say 11 people are dead and at least 20 more have been injured after a car ramming attack in the Canadian city. Here's what we know.

title.children: What we know about the deadly 'car ramming attack' in Canada

image.altText: A photo of Samuel Hockey.

props.synopsis: A new nasal spray that uses a form of ketamine to treat stubborn depression will be added to the PBS, making treatment cheaper for thousands of Australians.

title.children: Ketamine-based nasal spray 'just the beginning' for depression patients

image.altText: drone shot of a hospital sitting among leafy suburban streets

props.synopsis: I've seen the future of an important part of Australia's healthcare system — a private hospital owned by a health insurance company.

title.children: A private hospital opens in Melbourne with no out-of-pocket costs

image.altText: Headshot of Donna Nelson wearing a black shirt with a garden behind her.

props.synopsis: Grandmother Donna Nelson sits alone in a Japanese jail for 23 hours a day, far from the life she planned with her online boyfriend of two years. The court accepted the 59-year-old was love scammed, but sentenced her anyway.

title.children: Donna's trip of a lifetime landed her in jail in Japan

image.altText: Nathan Brown promotes a multi bet on television.

props.synopsis: The Sportsbet "live odds" segments hosted by former player Nathan Brown was an AFL television broadcast mainstay for years. Why have they suddenly stopped?

title.children: After the losses were revealed, these Sportsbet TV segments stopped

image.altText: a campaign poster for Vivek Singha the Liberal candidate for Fowler in Western Sydney

props.synopsis: The ABC uncovers social media posts by Liberal candidate Vivek Singha in which he repeatedly uses a derogatory term for Indigenous Australians and takes aim at Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek over a personal family matter.

title.children: Liberal candidate for Western Sydney seat apologises for offensive posts

image.altText: Arne Slot and Virgil van Dijk look up at the crowd together and smile after the clinching the title

props.synopsis: Replacing an iconic manager at a famous club is often a poisoned chalice, but Arne Slot responded to the impossible task of following up Jürgen Klopp by doing the unthinkable.

title.children: Having been given an impossible task, Arne Slot delivers in spades for Liverpool

image.altText: A photo of China's crewed submersible, the Fendhouze, held aloft above the water before going in.

props.synopsis: China's new cable-cutter has been making headlines, but how much of a threat is it really?

title.children: What China's new cable-cutter signals for Australia

image.altText: Pope Francis hugs Filipino Cardinal Luis Antonio Tagle.

props.synopsis: There's increasing hope among Catholics in the Philippines that one of their own, Cardinal Luis Tagle, might become Asia's first Pope.

title.children: Frontrunner for next pope seen as open minded, but hasn't led change

image.altText: A boys sits on red blanket with a white bandage over his head

props.synopsis: Seven-year-old Ali Faraj Faraj, covered in blood and dust, could be seen crying amongst the rubble of a home in Gaza City. His father and five sisters were killed in the strike on Thursday.

title.children: An Israeli missile strike threw this 7yo onto his neighbour's roof — his father's body lay feet away

image.altText: A large plume of smoke over the skyline of Beirut.

props.synopsis: Israel launches air strikes on the Lebanese capital Beirut, targeting what it claims was a Hezbollah missile store in the city's south.

title.children: Lebanon accuses Israel of breaching ceasefire with fresh strikes

image.altText: people holding placards in a march to protest violence against women

props.synopsis: Protest organisers decried the lack of action around violence against women as hundreds marched in the NSW Central Coast inspired by the death of local Audrey Griffin.

title.children: Hundreds brave rain to protest gendered violence after death of woman

image.altText: A hand holding a phone with a computer in the background

props.synopsis: As artificial intelligence becomes more prolific in modern society, scammers are using the tool to produce highly convincing scams that leave even the experts second-guessing.

title.children: The ABC fact-checked an AI scam. Here's what we found

image.altText: A composite image of eight book covers on a green and blue background

props.synopsis: There's a confronting work of non-fiction by an award-winning Australian writer, a smart rom-com set in Brexit-era London for fans of Dolly Alderton and a supernatural thriller that will leave you gasping in this month's ABC Arts recommendations.

title.children: A rom-com with a twist and a dystopian thriller: April's best books

image.altText: Four people walking amongst streets with new builds behind them

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton prepare for a sprint to the election finish line, some South Australians could be questioning if their state is part of the race.

title.children: Does South Australia matter this federal election?

image.altText: A black and white image of an Australian Light Horseman in full uniform and kit mounted on his horse.

props.synopsis: Emu feathers on a slouch hat are a powerful symbol of the Australian Light Horse, and two army veterans are combining their skills so the tradition lives on.

title.children: Light Horse emu plumes: The darker the feather, the better the rider

image.altText: A big ocean wave

props.synopsis: Weather conditions are settling across Queensland today and are expected to continue tomorrow, but showers are expected along much of the coast ahead of the Labour Day long weekend.

title.children: Rain, big winds, heavy surf forecast for Qld Labour Day long weekend

image.altText: Liverpool players smile in red jersey with Champions on it

props.synopsis: Liverpool win the English Premier League with a 5-1 victory over Ange Postecoglou's Tottenham at Anfield.

title.children: Liverpool seal Premier League title with 5-1 rout of Ange's Spurs

image.altText: A sepia-tinged photo of a man holding a large crocodile.

props.synopsis: A crocodile wrangler from the country may sound like an unlikely advocate for LGBTQIA+ Australians in parliament. But Warren Entsch is just that — and it all started in a pub.

title.children: The out-of-the-blue reunion in a purple pub that changed Australia

image.altText: A young woman in white pants scrolls on her phone.

props.synopsis: Advocates say social media is a "lifeline" for young people with disability, so they should be part of designing and testing elements of the federal government's ban.

title.children: Disability community asks to co-design 'isolating' social media ban

image.altText: Peter Dutton in a suit.

props.synopsis: If the world is re-arming, shouldn't we boosting funding for the public service?

title.children: As the world re-arms, should we treat our public service with more respect?

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a pink background wearing a silver glittery fress

props.synopsis: The news was announced by her family, who shared a statement on social media.

title.children: RuPaul's Drag Race star Jiggly Caliente dies, aged 44

image.altText: orange red and black smoke bellow from a port after an explosion

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for Iran's crisis management organisation said there had been prior warnings over the containment of the chemicals at the port.

title.children: Death toll rises after suspected chemical explosion at Iranian port

image.altText: A woman in a swimsuit on a boat

props.synopsis: Queensland tourism officials are harking back to the 1980s with a campaign based on a cover of Madonna's hit Holiday to tempt people back to the state.

title.children: Queensland tourism campaign taps nostalgia with Madonna hit
